website_summaries.verdict: The $150 Slingbox M1 brings TV streaming to nearly any mobile device, PC, or Mac, now with the convenience of built-in Wi-Fi.
pros: The affordable Slingbox M1 streams video from your TV or DVR (or any analog source) to your PC, tablet, smartphone, and some streaming boxes at resolutions up to full 1080p HD
IR blasters are built into the box's body, eliminating the need for annoying extra external wires
There are no monthly charges or fees and setup is even easier thanks to built-in dual-band Wi-Fi
cons: Smartphone- and tablet-viewing apps cost extra
It duplicates some of the features found on TV anywhere apps you may already be using
As always, streaming capabilities are only as good as your home bandwidth

website_summaries.verdict: If you want to watch live TV on your mobile devices, the Slingbox M1 is the most affordable place-shifting device yet, even if you need to pay extra for the apps.
cons: Slingbox and connected HDTV can only watch one channel at a time between them

customer_reviews.title: Once great, but a money grab via ads turns this great box into something ugly.
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Slingbox user for many years - upgraded to the M1 a few months back, and all was great... until yesterday, when they turned on advertising banners. It now uses up a huge chunk of the space in the player app, and not only that, but the ads are animated, and a huge distraction while watching a show. This is not what I paid for, and adding this "feature" after the fact is shady at best, stupid to the extreme as their sales are about to drop like a rock as a result. I'll gladly update my review back to 5 stars if they revert to the previous software minus ads.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dinkins

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY (unless you love ads)

The simple fact is that even after you purchase the product and use the LOCAL desktop app to view content within your own home Sling has decided you should view ads. Yup, they are FORCING ads on you. The company decided to compromise the experience and its customer privacy by loading your computer with what has now effectively become adware. It's a silly move, and I can't trust the company any more. You should not trust any company who is willing to sell you on a promise and then turn around and lie about it, and Slingbox has become this company.

customer_reviews.title: Great for watching movies
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to watch NFL football games on my Roku. Initially the software was pretty buggy and the games were unwatchable, just a mess of pixilated boxes, blurry and prone to pausing. The stability of the connection has improved but it still isn't perfect for fast moving high action sports. It is great for movies where elements of a scene are relatively stationary and do not need to be constantly refreshed. This is due to the underlying H264 video encoding technology. Unfortunately the device does not offer a way to fine tune the video quality but you can choose from several presets. Would love the ability to tune framerate and GOP length. NOT COMPATIBLE WITH SLING WEBSITE PLAYER.

customer_reviews.title: Check your cable box before you order!
customer_reviews.text: Check your cable box outputs. You need a 3-color Component (Green/Blue/Red) Cable + Red/White Audio. By cable box only has the 3-color cable. I am able to configure either (a) no sound but decent picture; or (b) B&W picture + sound. According to Slingbox website, workaround is a HDMI converter box for $70 that was not available at time of review. I searched Amazon for a similar converter, but could not find the same configuration.

I expect some may find ability to share siblings' packages too. But what has me most impressed is the ability to use the Chromecast allowing viewing on almost any TV (versus a Tablet or phone). If you have an Apple IPhone and want to stream it to your apple TV it only works at about 480i, a lot like watching a video from a VCR. It also loses connectivity with the router regularly. It's like someone said, "hey! I have a great idea for an April Fools Joke."

The biggest issue I have with it is being able to Fast Forward/Rewind/Stop/Start through the controls on my iphone - there is a distinct lag in time so it can get frustrating. Other than that, I love having the access - when the weather is good, there are no connectivity problems. However, if the weather is bad here or in the states, connectivity can be sketchy and frequently interrupted.

product_meta.title: Sling Media Slingbox M1
product_meta.description: Watch your TV Anywhere - Sling box is the easy way to take your living room TV experience with you wherever you go. You'll be able to see each and every channel you have available on your television via Sling box. It works over Wi-Fi networks, as well as 3G and 4G cellular networks without restriction when you travel. Even internationally. Basically if you can connect to the Internet, you'll be able to watch all your channels live on any device, like your laptop, tablet, or phone. You can even use a streaming device like Roku or Apple TV to watch live TV on a second television. Watch your cable or satellite subscription at your vacation home or on that TV in the bedroom or basement. All without extra monthly fees. Sling box lets you watch your TV live in up to Full HD at 1080p resolution. It will connect with your home's Internet router via Wi-Fi or an Ethernet connection. You connect to your cable or satellite set-top box via component cables and the signal passes through to your TV. You can also connect it to your DVR, DVD, or Blu-ray Disc player/recorder or a video security camera if you choose. Integrated and external IR emitters give you the ability to control these remotely. Perfect for the sports fan - If you're a die-hard sports fan who travels, Sling box is a must-have. The extra channels and coverage you're already paying for are all available without having to worry about "blackouts" or device restrictions. And there are no monthly fees. Compatible with most Cable and Satellite providers - ATandT, Bright House Networks, Cablevision, Charter Communications, Comcast Xfinity, Cox Communications, DirecTV, Dish Network, Time Warner, and Verizon FiOs + more! Setup is simple, view your TV remotely from phones, tablets, PC/Mac, streaming devices, All with no monthly fees.
